column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am taking HRT (Prempro for 5 yrs+) for a total of 21 years.  I feel terrific, I am 5'7", weigh 140 lbs, I am 65 years old, nogray hair, muscular with no fat + a very active mind that has read most of the classics.  Neither do I have a wrinkle on myface and I have never had any cosmeticsurgery.  I ride an exercise bike every other day for 50 min. and I lift free weights on the in-between days.  I'm suregenetics plays a part - I'm Swedish and German - but I will continue to take Premproindefinitely.

column2: nswift, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking .625 and it completely relieved my hot flashes, dry vagina, sleep problems, & mood swings.  After 6 weeks, I began having severe bumps & pimples from Rosacea.  I took this level for 6 months then I switched to .3  On this lower dosage, my "change of life" symptoms were only somewhat relieved, the Rosacea acne improved to a moderate status, however the hair on my head is now rather thin.  Is my severe Rosacea & hair thinning from natural aging or a medication side effect?  I went to my doctor yesterday and I am going to try a different medication.

column9: While it did work for the most part.   I was not informed of how hard it would be to stop using premarin.
